record.title: AUTHORITY FOR COMMITTEES TO MEET
record.narrative:
AUTHORITY FOR COMMITTEES TO MEET -- (Senate - May 20, 2008)

[Page: S4548]

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON BANKING, HOUSING, AND URBAN AFFAIRS
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on May 20, 2008, at 10:30 a.m.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON ENERGY AND NATURAL RESOURCES
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate to conduct a hearing on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 10 a.m., in room SD366 of the Dirksen Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Foreign Relations be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 10:30 a.m., to hold a hearing on law enforcement treaties.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Foreign Relations be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 2:15 p.m. to hold a business meeting.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Foreign Relations be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 2:45 p.m. to hold a hearing on Pakistan.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON HEALTH, EDUCATION, LABOR, AND PENSIONS
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions be authorized to meet, during the session of the Senate, to conduct a hearing entitled "Plant Closings, Workers' Rights and the WARN Act's 20th Anniversary" on Tuesday, May 20, 2008: The hearing will commence at 10 a.m. in room 430 of the Dirksen Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON HOMELAND SECURITY AND GOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 10:30 a.m. to conduct a hearing entitled "Financial Speculation in Commodity Markets: Are Institutional Investors and Hedge Funds Contributing to Food and Energy Price Inflation?".

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate Committee on the Judiciary be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate, to conduct a hearing entitled "Protecting the Constitutional Rights to Vote for All Americans" on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 2:30 p.m., in room SD-226 of the Dirksen Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Select Committee on Intelligence be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate on May 20, 2008, at 2:30 p.m. to hold a hearing.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: SUBCOMMITTEE ON HUMAN RIGHTS AND THE LAW
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate Committee on the Judiciary, Subcommittee on Human Rights and the Law, be authorized to meet during the session of the Senate, to conduct a hearing entitled "Global Internet Freedom: Corporate Responsibility and the Rule of Law" on Tuesday, May 20, 2008, at 10 a.m., in room SD-226 of the Dirksen Senate Office Building.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
